title: Bringing it All Together
description: Some examples of using all our tools to create data visualizations.
contents:
Data Exploration
Here we have a nice figure in which we can do some initial data exploration regarding carapace width by latitude.



Data Table
Here is a data table with some basic info about our fiddler crabs at different sites

Temperature vs Carapace Width
Here we can see the possible correlation between mean carapace width and temperature



Citations
Johnson, D. 2019. Fiddler crab body size in salt marshes from Florida to Massachusetts, USA at PIE and VCR LTER and NOAA NERR sites during summer 2016. ver 1. Environmental Data Initiative. https://doi.org/10.6073/pasta/4c27d2e778d3325d3830a5142e3839bb (Accessed 2021-08-20).
Wickham et al., (2019). Welcome to the tidyverse. Journal of Open Source Software, 4(43), 1686, https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.01686
Kirill Müller (2020). here: A Simpler Way to Find Your Files. R package version 1.0.1. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=here
Garrett Grolemund, Hadley Wickham (2011). Dates and Times Made Easy with lubridate. Journal of Statistical Software, 40(3), 1-25. URL https://www.jstatsoft.org/v40/i03/.
Sam Firke (2021). janitor: Simple Tools for Examining and Cleaning Dirty Data. R package version 2.1.0. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=janitor
Hao Zhu (2021). kableExtra: Construct Complex Table with ‘kable’ and Pipe Syntax. R package version 1.3.4. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=kableExtra

title: Data Wrangling
description: Here are some new functions I learned which help quickly tabulate large data sets.
contents:
-filter() <- used for rows
-mutate() <- adds a new column
-select() <- used for columns
-summarize() <- creates a new data table
-group_by() <- groups variables for calculations
-case_when() <- can filter and select by conditional statements
